verses.kjv: Now therefore hearken, O Israel, unto the statutes and unto the judgments, which I teach you, for to do them, that ye may live, and go in and possess the land which the LORD God of your fathers giveth you.
verses.ct: "Now listen, Israel, to the rules and regulations that I am teaching you to follow, so that you may live and enter and take possession of the land that the LORD, the God of your ancestors, is giving you.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall ye diminish ought from it, that ye may keep the commandments of the LORD your God which I command you.
verses.ct: Don't add anything to what I am commanding you, and don't take anything away from it. Instead, obey the commands of the LORD your God that I am giving you.

verses.kjv: Your eyes have seen what the LORD did because of Baalpeor: for all the men that followed Baalpeor, the LORD thy God hath destroyed them from among you.
verses.ct: You saw with your own eyes what the LORD did at Baal Peor — the LORD your God wiped out from among you everyone who followed Baal Peor.

verses.kjv: But ye that did cleave unto the LORD your God are alive every one of you this day.
verses.ct: But all of you who held on to the LORD your God are still alive today.

verses.kjv: Behold, I have taught you statutes and judgments, even as the LORD my God commanded me, that ye should do so in the land whither ye go to possess it.
verses.ct: Look, I have taught you rules and regulations just as the LORD my God instructed me, so that you can follow them in the land you are about to enter and possess.

verses.kjv: Keep therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the nations, which shall hear all these statutes, and say, Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.
verses.ct: So observe and practice them, because this will demonstrate your wisdom and understanding to the other nations. When they hear about all these rules, they will say, 'This great nation truly is a wise and understanding people.'

verses.kjv: For what nation is there so great, who hath God so nigh unto them, as the LORD our God is in all things that we call upon him for?
verses.ct: What other nation is so great that it has its God so near to it, the way the LORD our God is near to us whenever we call on him?

verses.kjv: And what nation is there so great, that hath statutes and judgments so righteous as all this law, which I set before you this day?
verses.ct: And what other nation is so great that it has rules and regulations as just as this entire law that I am placing in front of you today?

verses.kjv: Only take heed to thyself, and keep thy soul diligently, lest thou forget the things which thine eyes have seen, and lest they depart from thy heart all the days of thy life: but teach them thy sons, and thy sons’ sons;
verses.ct: Just be careful and guard yourself closely, so that you don't forget the things you witnessed with your own eyes, and so they never fade from your heart as long as you live. Teach them to your children and your grandchildren —

verses.kjv: Specially the day that thou stoodest before the LORD thy God in Horeb, when the LORD said unto me, Gather me the people together, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they shall live upon the earth, and that they may teach their children.
verses.ct: especially about the day you stood in the presence of the LORD your God at Horeb, when the LORD told me, 'Assemble the people before me so I can let them hear my words. Then they will learn to deeply revere me for as long as they live on the earth, and they will teach their children as well.'

verses.kjv: And ye came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain burned with fire unto the midst of heaven, with darkness, clouds, and thick darkness.
verses.ct: You came forward and stood at the base of the mountain while it blazed with fire reaching up into the heavens, surrounded by darkness, clouds, and deep gloom.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto you out of the midst of the fire: ye heard the voice of the words, but saw no similitude; only ye heard a voice.
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to you from the middle of the fire. You heard the sound of words, but you didn't see any form — there was only a voice.

verses.kjv: And he declared unto you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even ten commandments; and he wrote them upon two tables of stone.
verses.ct: He announced his covenant to you, which he commanded you to follow — the 10 commandments — and he wrote them on 2 stone tablets.

verses.kjv: And the LORD commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and judgments, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to possess it.
verses.ct: At that same time, the LORD directed me to teach you rules and regulations for you to practice in the land you are crossing over to possess.

verses.kjv: Take ye therefore good heed unto yourselves; for ye saw no manner of similitude on the day that the LORD spake unto you in Horeb out of the midst of the fire:
verses.ct: So be extremely careful — since you did not see any form on the day the LORD spoke to you at Horeb from the middle of the fire —

verses.kjv: Lest ye corrupt yourselves, and make you a graven image, the similitude of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
verses.ct: don't corrupt yourselves by making a carved idol in any shape or form, whether it looks like a man or a woman,

verses.kjv: The likeness of any beast that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged fowl that flieth in the air,
verses.ct: or like any animal on the earth, or any bird that flies through the air,

verses.kjv: The likeness of any thing that creepeth on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the waters beneath the earth:
verses.ct: or anything that crawls on the ground, or any fish in the waters below the earth.

verses.kjv: And lest thou lift up thine eyes unto heaven, and when thou seest the sun, and the moon, and the stars, even all the host of heaven, shouldest be driven to worship them, and serve them, which the LORD thy God hath divided unto all nations under the whole heaven.
verses.ct: And when you look up toward the heavens and see the sun, the moon, and the stars — the entire array of heaven — don't let yourselves be lured into bowing down to them and serving them. The LORD your God has assigned those to all the nations under the whole heavens.

verses.kjv: But the LORD hath taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, even out of Egypt, to be unto him a people of inheritance, as ye are this day.
verses.ct: But the LORD took you and brought you out of the iron furnace — out of Egypt — to become his own treasured people, as you are today.

verses.kjv: Furthermore the LORD was angry with me for your sakes, and sware that I should not go over Jordan, and that I should not go in unto that good land, which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance:
verses.ct: The LORD was angry with me because of you, and he swore that I would not cross the Jordan or enter that good land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.

verses.kjv: But I must die in this land, I must not go over Jordan: but ye shall go over, and possess that good land.
verses.ct: I will die in this land; I will not cross the Jordan. But you will cross over and take possession of that good land.

verses.kjv: Take heed unto yourselves, lest ye forget the covenant of the LORD your God, which he made with you, and make you a graven image, or the likeness of any thing, which the LORD thy God hath forbidden thee.
verses.ct: Be on guard so that you don't forget the covenant that the LORD your God made with you by making a carved idol in the shape of anything the LORD your God has prohibited.

verses.kjv: For the LORD thy God is a consuming fire, even a jealous God.
verses.ct: Because the LORD your God is an all-consuming fire, a God who demands exclusive devotion.

verses.kjv: When thou shalt beget children, and children’s children, and ye shall have remained long in the land, and shall corrupt yourselves, and make a graven image, or the likeness of any thing, and shall do evil in the sight of the LORD thy God, to provoke him to anger:
verses.ct: After you have had children and grandchildren and have lived in the land a long time, if you become corrupt and make a carved idol in any form, doing what is evil in the sight of the LORD your God and provoking him to anger —

verses.kjv: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye go over Jordan to possess it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed.
verses.ct: I call the heavens and the earth as witnesses against you today that you will quickly be completely wiped out from the land you are crossing the Jordan to possess. You will not last long there but will be totally destroyed.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall scatter you among the nations, and ye shall be left few in number among the heathen, whither the LORD shall lead you.
verses.ct: The LORD will scatter you among the nations, and only a small number of you will survive among the peoples where the LORD drives you.

verses.kjv: And there ye shall serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
verses.ct: There you will worship gods made by human hands — objects of wood and stone that cannot see, hear, eat, or smell.

verses.kjv: But if from thence thou shalt seek the LORD thy God, thou shalt find him, if thou seek him with all thy heart and with all thy soul.
verses.ct: But if from there you search for the LORD your God, you will find him, as long as you seek him with all your heart and all your soul.

verses.kjv: When thou art in tribulation, and all these things are come upon thee, even in the latter days, if thou turn to the LORD thy God, and shalt be obedient unto his voice;
verses.ct: When you are in distress and all these things have happened to you, then in the days to come, if you return to the LORD your God and listen to him —

verses.kjv: (For the LORD thy God is a merciful God;) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them.
verses.ct: (because the LORD your God is a merciful God) — he will not abandon you or destroy you or forget the covenant he swore to your ancestors.

verses.kjv: For ask now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the day that God created man upon the earth, and ask from the one side of heaven unto the other, whether there hath been any such thing as this great thing is, or hath been heard like it?
verses.ct: Ask about the days long past, before your time, going all the way back to when God created humanity on the earth. Search from one end of the heavens to the other — has anything this incredible ever happened, or has anything like it ever been heard of?

verses.kjv: Did ever people hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as thou hast heard, and live?
verses.ct: Has any people ever heard the voice of God speaking from the middle of a fire, as you did, and survived?

verses.kjv: Or hath God assayed to go and take him a nation from the midst of another nation, by temptations, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by a stretched out arm, and by great terrors, according to all that the LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
verses.ct: Has any god ever attempted to go and take one nation out from inside another nation through trials, signs, wonders, war, a powerful hand, an outstretched arm, and terrifying acts — like everything the LORD your God did for you in Egypt right before your eyes?

verses.kjv: Unto thee it was shewed, that thou mightest know that the LORD he is God; there is none else beside him.
verses.ct: You were shown these things so that you would recognize that the LORD is God — there is no other besides him.

verses.kjv: Out of heaven he made thee to hear his voice, that he might instruct thee: and upon earth he shewed thee his great fire; and thou heardest his words out of the midst of the fire.
verses.ct: From the heavens he let you hear his voice to instruct you, and on earth he showed you his great fire, and you heard his words from the middle of that fire.

verses.kjv: And because he loved thy fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and brought thee out in his sight with his mighty power out of Egypt;
verses.ct: Because he loved your ancestors, he chose their descendants after them and personally brought you out of Egypt with his great power.

verses.kjv: To drive out nations from before thee greater and mightier than thou art, to bring thee in, to give thee their land for an inheritance, as it is this day.
verses.ct: He did this to drive out nations greater and more powerful than you from ahead of you, to bring you into their land and give it to you as an inheritance, as it is today.

verses.kjv: Know therefore this day, and consider it in thine heart, that the LORD he is God in heaven above, and upon the earth beneath: there is none else.
verses.ct: So acknowledge today and take it to heart that the LORD is God in the heavens above and on the earth below — there is no other.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt keep therefore his statutes, and his commandments, which I command thee this day, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee, and that thou mayest prolong thy days upon the earth, which the LORD thy God giveth thee, for ever.
verses.ct: Obey his rules and commands that I am giving you today, so that things will go well for you and your children after you, and so that you will live long in the land that the LORD your God is giving you permanently."

verses.kjv: Then Moses severed three cities on this side Jordan toward the sunrising;
verses.ct: Then Moses designated 3 cities on the east side of the Jordan, toward the sunrise,

verses.kjv: That the slayer might flee thither, which should kill his neighbour unawares, and hated him not in times past; and that fleeing unto one of these cities he might live:
verses.ct: where someone who accidentally killed a neighbor without any prior hostility could flee and find safety by escaping to one of these cities.

verses.kjv: Namely, Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, of the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, of the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, of the Manassites.
verses.ct: These were: Bezer in the wilderness on the plateau for the Reubenites, Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites.

verses.kjv: And this is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel:
verses.ct: This is the law that Moses presented to the Israelites.

verses.kjv: These are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the judgments, which Moses spake unto the children of Israel, after they came forth out of Egypt,
verses.ct: These are the instructions, rules, and regulations that Moses delivered to the Israelites after they came out of Egypt,

verses.kjv: On this side Jordan, in the valley over against Bethpeor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel smote, after they were come forth out of Egypt:
verses.ct: on the east side of the Jordan, in the valley opposite Beth Peor, in the territory of Sihon king of the Amorites, who ruled from Heshbon. Moses and the Israelites had defeated him after they came out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And they possessed his land, and the land of Og king of Bashan, two kings of the Amorites, which were on this side Jordan toward the sunrising;
verses.ct: They took possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan — the 2 Amorite kings on the east side of the Jordan, toward the sunrise —

verses.kjv: From Aroer, which is by the bank of the river Arnon, even unto mount Sion, which is Hermon,
verses.ct: from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon gorge all the way to Mount Sirion (that is, Hermon),

verses.kjv: And all the plain on this side Jordan eastward, even unto the sea of the plain, under the springs of Pisgah.
verses.ct: including the entire plain east of the Jordan as far as the Dead Sea, below the slopes of Pisgah.
